key_insight: Train an MLLM as an automated auditor (via reinforcement learning) to generate challenging questions and counterfactual images that maximize disagreement across target models, revealing interpretable capability gaps and enabling targeted fixes.
problem_solved: Conventional evaluations for multimodal LLMs are opaque and miss important failure modes; AuditDM systematically discovers divergences between models to expose and prioritize real capability gaps for correction.
method: Fine-tune an MLLM auditor with reinforcement learning to produce questions and counterfactual images that maximize disagreement among target MLLMs.
Measure model divergence on these adversarial inputs to localize interpretable failure modes (task- or concept-level).
Use discovered failure modes to guide rectification (e.g., targeted fine-tuning, data augmentation, or focused evaluation) to close capability gaps.
impact: Provides practitioners a practical, automated way to surface and prioritize hidden weaknesses across multimodal models, enabling more efficient debugging, targeted improvement, and robust deployment decisions.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: Auditor (RL-trained MLLM) → Generates Qs & counterfactual images → Multiple target MLLMs → Disagreement detector → Failure-mode repository
Heatmap matrix: models vs. tasks/concepts showing intensity of disagreement (capability gaps)
Before/After examples: paired image + question where models disagree, then show corrected model behavior after rectification
RL loop inset: reward signal based on inter-model divergence with sample generation and auditor update
paper_title: Differences That Matter: Auditing Models for Capability Gap Discovery and Rectification
paper_authors: Qihao Liu, Chengzhi Mao, Yaojie Liu, Alan Yuille, Wen-Sheng Chu
